k01: Enter your basic information so it is saved on your device only and not sent to any server.
k02: Enter the date of your last treatment dose (such as injection or IV infusion). The system will calculate the next dose date after 6 months with an approximate reminder.
k07: Visual fatigue and discomfort in the eyes
k12: Select the symptoms you experienced today so they can be saved in a daily log you can review with your doctor.
k15: Use blue-light filter glasses when needed
k16: Fried foods (such as french fries and fried chicken)
k20: Avoid direct strong lights and neon lights
k25: Multiple sclerosis is a long journey, but not one you take alone. Emotional and psychological support helps greatly in coping.
k28: Trans fats (commercial baked goods, unhealthy snacks)
k29: The following links are examples of trusted resources about multiple sclerosis.
k30: Vegetables: spinach, broccoli, carrots, colorful peppers
k33: Added sugars (soft drinks and artificial sweets)
k35: Oats, whole wheat bread, brown rice
k37: Nuts: almonds, walnuts, cashews, flax and chia seeds
k40: Fast food high in saturated fats
k41: Some MS patients are sensitive to bright lights, especially strong white lights or bright screens, which may cause:
k43: Effect of bright lights on MS nerves
k59: Increased dizziness or loss of balance
k64: Drinking water is essential to maintain energy and nerve health. Track your cups today.
k70: Every small step you take today is a real achievement. Focus on what you can do now.
k71: Track symptoms, reminders, and daily tips in one simple and safe place.
k74: Location of last relapse in the body
k79: Educational demo platform—does not replace a specialist.
k84: Write any important details you want to remember later.
k86: Personal data saved on this device.
k92: Last injection date saved and next dose calculated.
k93: Try to reach 6–8 cups today to maintain fluid balance.
k94: Well done! You are in the ideal range today.
k95: It's okay to drink more, but avoid excess if you have health issues.
k96: You are not your illness; you are a strong person facing a challenge.
k97: Every day you wake up and fight is a new victory added to your record.
k98: Take things step by step; even long distances are covered with small steps.
k99: You have the right to feel tired, but do not give up. Rest is part of the journey.
k100: There is always something beautiful worth continuing for, even if small.
k101: Ask for help when needed; true strength is in acknowledging it.
k102: Your mental health is as important as your physical health.
k103: Even on difficult days, your existence is a gift to those around you.
